effect.text: Choose 1 Energy card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pok√©mon and discard it.

requirements.description: Opponent must have at least one Pokemon with Energy attached

tips: Prioritize removing Double Colorless Energy when possible (removes 2 Energy value)
Target Active Pokemon's Energy to prevent immediate attacks
Remove Energy from benched Pokemon being powered up for future turns
Use aggressively in early game to prevent opponent from establishing board
Combine with offensive pressure - removal alone doesn't win, but buying time for KOs does
Run 3-4 copies in aggressive decks like Haymaker
Less effective against Rain Dance decks that can easily reattach Water Energy

rulings.ruling: Choose 1 Energy card attached to any of your opponent's Pokemon (Active or Benched)
The chosen Energy card is discarded to the opponent's discard pile
You can choose to discard any type of Energy (Basic Energy or Special Energy)
You cannot play Energy Removal if your opponent has no Pokemon with Energy attached
You choose which Energy to discard if the Pokemon has multiple Energy attached
Discarding Double Colorless Energy removes both Energy at once (it's 1 card providing 2 Energy)
You can see which Energy cards are attached to opponent's Pokemon before choosing
